TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed SynchronizationOption extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the type of automatic synchronization requested by the component.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the SynchronizationOption type.
[!code-vb[EnterpriseServicesSynchronizationOption#0](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.enterpriseservi_6_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[EnterpriseServicesSynchronizationOption#0](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.enterpriseservi_6_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServicesSynchronizationOption#0](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.enterpriseservi_6_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.EnterpriseServices.SynchronizationOption Disabled = int32(0)

Docs.summary: COM+ ignores the synchronization requirements of the component when determining context for the object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.EnterpriseServices.SynchronizationOption NotSupported = int32(1)

Docs.summary: An object with this value never participates in synchronization, regardless of the status of its caller. This setting is only available for components that are non-transactional and do not use just-in-time (JIT) activation.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.EnterpriseServices.SynchronizationOption Required = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Ensures that all objects created from the component are synchronized.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.EnterpriseServices.SynchronizationOption RequiresNew = int32(4)

Docs.summary: An object with this value must participate in a new synchronization where COM+ manages contexts and apartments on behalf of all components involved in the call.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.EnterpriseServices.SynchronizationOption Supported = int32(2)

Docs.summary: An object with this value participates in synchronization, if it exists.
